results.title: Esty Deez
results.creator_credit: Tom McPartland, Sabina Wynn and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A frank look at the importance of using condoms to prevent sexually transmited diseases. Discusses the dangers of having multiple sexual partners and what should be done if an STD is contracted. Depicts the behaviour of adolescents together with contemporary language to ensure the attention of the intended audience. NB: TEACHER PREVIEW PRIOR TO CLASSROOM VIEWING IS RECOMMENDED.

results.title: STD's . . . Not just long distance phone calls
results.creator_credit: Wendy Thompson, Sabina Wynn and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: An entertaining look at the ways in which sexually transmitted diseases are transmitted and how they can (mostly) be cured. Looks at what happens at an STD clinic and encourages the use of condoms to prevent STDs.

results.title: Last resort
results.creator_credit: Robert Scarfe and Victoria. Dept. of Education and Early Childhood Development
results.brief_description: An insight into the role and function of the Victorian Ombudsman through the dramatization of actual cases investigated by the Office. Includes an interview with the Ombudsman.

results.title: Sunrise sunset
results.creator_credit: Chris O'Rourke and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: This program shows some of the changes currently occurring in local industries, tracing the development of the robot industry and the implications this has had for production costs and changes in job direction. Particular emphasis is on the importance of research and development - ideas and innovations.

results.title: Good cleaning fun: housework down the years
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Bob Scarfe, TV Ed Productions and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch

video_links.name: Good cleaning fun: housework down the years

results.brief_description: An education officer from the Museum of Victoria looks at a number of “labour saving appliances” used in the home over the last one hundred and fifty years and looks at the development of laundry and kitchen appliances.

results.title: Integrated curriculum
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Chris O'Rourke, Lily Steiner and Victoria. Schools Division. Curriculum Branch
results.brief_description: Shows how an integrated curriculum can operate in classrooms with children ranging from preparatory to years five and six. It shows how different areas of the curriculum can be integrated to promote learning.

results.title: Preparing your child for school
results.creator_credit: Jeff Spencer, Glen Iver, Trevor Lunn and Victoria. Ministry of Education
results.brief_description: The start of a child’s schooling should set a positive tone for the rest of school life. This program looks at some common issues relevant to children about to start school and aims to put both the new pupil and the parent at ease.

results.title: Westgarthtown: the German settlement at Thomastown
results.creator_credit: Stuart Miller and Multicultural Materials Production Project
results.brief_description: Provides an overview of the first German settlers to the Port Phillip District in 1850 who settled mainly at Westgarthtown which became Thomastown. These first settlers did not speak any English and brought the Lutheran religion to Australia. This German community worked hard to retain the values, beliefs and cultural background of Germany.

results.title: Accounting
results.brief_description: This program looks at what attracts people to Accounting as a career. It also looks at how computerization has changed the face of accounting. Industry and commerce, Government agencies, public accounting, education (research and development) are all possible career areas which require accountants.

results.title: Macbeth (Polanski)
results.creator_credit: Roman Polanski, Andrew Braunsberg, Caliban and Playboy
results.brief_description: Roman Polanski’s sharp and brutal version of the Shakespearean tragedy is stunning, mesmerising and brutal. A blood-stained visual palette allows Polanski to imbue the drama with his own metaphysical obsessions, particularly the intrusion of the irrational in human order. The film stays true to the Shakespearean narrative but it also stands on its own as a film about the darkness of power and lust. The brutal slaying of Polanski’s wife, Sharon Tate, by Charles Manson obviously affected the direction of the film, as did the savagery in Vietnam. By forcing the viewer to confront the violence implicit in Shakespeare’s play, this version of “Macbeth” extends the dimensions of the tragedy. It is not only Macbeth and Lady Macbeth’s destruction we witness. With unrelenting and hypnotic images, Polanski makes us confront the savagery of medieval Europe. Starring Jon Finch, Francesca Annis, Martin Shaw, Nicholas Selby and John Stride.
